text: Hi, anybody knows something like <https://launchkit.io/screenshots> (online screenshot editor)  but for android?

attachments.title: Screenshot Builder - Create gorgeous images for your App Store page in minutes.
attachments.text: LaunchKit's Screenshot Builder makes it easy to create gorgeous, custom images for your App Store page and export them in every resolution Apple requires.
attachments.fallback: Screenshot Builder: Screenshot Builder - Create gorgeous images for your App Store page in minutes.

text: <@U04UF3DMC>: this is the closet I know of, apart from the integrated screenshot feature in Android Studio: <https://developer.android.com/distribute/tools/promote/device-art.html>

attachments.text: Drag and drop screenshots of your app into device artwork, for better looking promotional images and improved visual context.
attachments.fallback: Drag and drop screenshots of your app into device artwork, for better looking promotional images and improved visual context.

text: <@U05165DUG|logcat> has joined the channel

<@U050ZUBQ6>: I think nearly every Android ToDo app supports creating elements via share actions. Of course you could make it super simple with just "click the button and it creates an entry without further interaction"
<@U05173MEQ|joakim> has joined the channel
<@U05199LV8|gkalsi> has joined the channel
<@U05199LV8|gkalsi> has joined the channel
<@U0519A2AL|kevinboudreault> has joined the channel

<@U04TK850N>: first of all thanks max - would you be interested in working with us? 

"Of course you could make it super simple with just "click the button and it creates an entry without further interaction"

Also would you mind sharing a wireframe of what you mean? <http://wireframe.cc> is a quick tool. Let me know if you have a few  because it will help me take it forward with my team

<@U050ZUBQ6>: Well, my issue is that I don't have the time to take on another project. UI wise it highly depends on what you want to do. If you want _just_ the creating bit from every app, you only need a login UI and that's it. Then let your app offer an intent filter for whatever content you want to be able to receive. If you want a full blown ToDo app with management of the created items and sync with the extension, then I'm the wrong to ask for an UI as I'm not a UI/UX guy :smile:
<http://forums.androidcentral.com/attachments/google-nexus-4/57422d1358866778t-copy-cut-paste-function-uploadfromtaptalk1358866775492.jpg>
See this
The 2nd icon from right is the default share action icon the user gets offered when they select text
At least in most apps
You Todo app would just pop up in this sub menu along other apps that offer support for this type of sharable content
So user selects text, choses your app to "share" with it, the app creates the entry, syncs to server and confirms with a toast or dialog
(or present the login if not yet logged in or session timed out in the meantime)
Acknowledged
thoughts are aligned

But this I believe is since youre are on chrome webbrowser? for other apps for ex. if I am chatting on my mobile on slack, whatsapp or fb - the longpress to select text and the option that show after it all differ?
The Android ShareActionProvider is a pretty standard thing most apps use in  this usecase. So even from other apps you will be available with your app
Ok I will share screenshots of this conversation with my team
thanks <@U04TK850N>
Also I will look into Android ShareActionProvider  in detail
Allow me to write back to you soon :simple_smile: Thanks! Much appreciated
Do write to me if you have a vision of Todoed working differently
:simple_smile:
